This means that the reward body, by nature, vows to deliver all sentient beings to the end, always abiding without extinction.

The third and fourth analogies correspond to the second type of person, who is born with mature faculties and diligently cultivates, not losing their original mind and gradually cultivating;

The tenth, eleventh, and twelfth correspond to the fourth type of person, who was born in the past with immature faculties and laziness, encountering Maitreya Buddha and attaining the Way, also giving rise to the great mind and first receiving a transformed rebirth;
